website_summaries.verdict: The Netgear Wireless-N Router WNR2000 is a no-frills budget wireless-N router, with excellent range and a handy and comprehensive Parental Control feature. It's a good fit for those who just need a simple wireless network and the ability to control access to the Internet.
pros: The Netgear Wireless-N Router WNR2000 offers decent throughput speeds, excellent range, is easy to use, and has an affordable price
It also comes with a free, comprehensive Parental Control feature
cons: The Netgear Wireless-N Router WNR2000 has no dual-band, Gigabit, USB, or Guest wireless features
Its Web interface is sluggish at times, and the Parental Control requires software installed on the computer to allow exceptions

customer_reviews.title: Falsely claims can work at 300Mbs!
customer_reviews.text: Got this N300 Model WNR2000v5 and it's no good. My internet speed tested at 239.06 Mbs before adding this router and only 94.27 Lbs after inserting the N300! Called Netgear and was told it can only do 100Mbs which is false advertising if you ask me. They said if you really want 300Mbs should buy a R7000. Can you believe it? A real arrogant position! Don't get this item and save yourself a headache!
customer_reviews.author: Gordon A. Stamper

customer_reviews.title: My aunt loves it.
customer_reviews.text: So, I bought this to update my aunt's aging home WiFi and she has been quite pleased with it. She says her laptop web browser loads her e-mail and websites faster and she is enjoying it. She was using a 10 year old wireless G router so this was a big improvement for her and was within her limited budget price range. In my opinion it is very nice router for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amar Rhom

customer_reviews.title: Never any problems
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router over 4 years ago and it is still going strong. It has been dropped a few times and I have transferred it back and forth to my office in emergency situations. Has no problem running 100 mbps speeds on several devices. I have about 10 different computers/tablets/phones connected to it constantly along with a Smart TV and Smart home theater. I have never had any problems with this and even bought another Netgear for my office.
customer_reviews.author: Carbon Jackson

customer_reviews.title: A Big Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I normally like Netgear stuff, but this router has to be rebooted every hour or two. The hardwired connections work flawlessly, but anything connected via the radio will have to deal with constantly dropped connections. I'm an electrical engineer with great troubleshooting skills and I've eliminated every other possibility. I'm experiencing simultaneous dropping of the wifi to two Kindle Fires, a Fire TV Stick, two Acer laptops, a Dell laptop and three Android phones. None of them are immune and they all lose their connections at the same time while the cable connected PCs keep humming along. It's too bad, too, because it has twice the range of the Linksys router it replaced. This one is going back, I'm afraid.
customer_reviews.author: Chelle

customer_reviews.title: Had three of them, all died in a year
customer_reviews.text: Should have wrote this a few years ago... purchased two of these for separate locations and both stopped working in just a little over a year. Wireless stopped working on one of them and the second stopped booting. Not recovery methods worked. Went through the "Backed by NETGEAR Lifetime Warranty" and paid shipping (!!!) for the replacement for one of them and that about 9 months later that one started losing it's mind and needed a tftp firmware reload to work again every month or so. I gave up and bought from another brand.
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: GOOD LUCK if you're going through an ISP provided modem!
customer_reviews.text: Had to work through Spectrum / Time Warner modem and was never able to get to the internet. I spent hours with Spectrum Teks and tried ti get help from Netgear but they make it very difficult to contact them. the brochures are meager to say the least and the internet turnaround for guidance is 24 hours for each email. There is no guarantee that the agent will answer all of the questions in the email; my experience is one response at a time. It took 60 days, three modems from Spectrum, one wireless router, and finally one dual wireless router and modem to determine the WR was no good to me.
customer_reviews.author: Vanghowent

customer_reviews.title: Works great for me
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd one of these I've bought, the first last year. That one has been totally reliable and was easy for Comcast / Xfinity to configure remotely. I at one time had 3 computers and an internet-connected TV hooked up with ethernet connections and it all worked.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Brown

customer_reviews.title: Not so fast?
customer_reviews.text: This is a difficult review because I don't really know if the router is a problem or not. It is used. I upgraded to high speed satellite service but had a 150mbs router. I upgraded to the N300 and expected much faster downloads than what I'm seeing. Pages don't seem to load any faster than before I upgraded and hitting "refresh" happens far too often. All maintenance software says that the computers are functioning properly. I ran satellite tests and they all were within stated parameters. Objectively, all I can say is that--it works. Both computers can access data. So the router upgrade didn't hinder system functioning but I can't honestly say that it helped either.
customer_reviews.author: Frenchy

customer_reviews.title: Great for router or extender.  Lifetime warranty can't be beat.
customer_reviews.text: I purchase these because they have a lifetime warranty. I have had 1 of my 2 replaced through Netgear. No issues with the return process. I am using the 2nd one as an extender. For the price and lifetime warranty, I opted to go this route. With the netgear wizard, installation was a breeze. Range isn't excellent, but for the lifetime warranty it's something I'm willing to deal with.
customer_reviews.author: RL.Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Fine thus far.
customer_reviews.text: I must not have looked closely at the reviews because I seldom/never buy anything with 26% negative reviews. Any how I bought one and thus far (6 months) it has worked fine; seldom requires a reboot. I only have 10 megs down and I run my tv, computer, and phone without any problems. The last firmware update screwed things a bit but I got it sorted without too much work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Recommended Router routes right
customer_reviews.text: We recently switched to an upgraded satellite internet delivery system. The old router was. according to the installer, robbing the system of speed and functionality. This Netgear product was recommended as the best replacement. It was simple to install, bbegan working right away, and works well. My only problem with it was that the installation guide did not suggest there might be incombatibility with perifferal equipment. We noticed sometime after installing it, that a Canon printer would no longer work wirelessly. Evenetually (from Canon) we discovered the need ot match the printer to the router. A note to that effect would have been helpful. I received the well-packaged device on the scheduled day, as promised.
customer_reviews.author: A Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Unit and Works Very Well. Menu's easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Nice unit, smaller than the previous Netgear WNR200 but it seems to work fine. Keep in mind that when you are using this with wifi devices, you should check the signal strength on your connected wifi computer. There are 11 channels and the default channel is not always the best channel for you. Use "WifiInfoView" and see who is on the same channel in your area and then select the channel that is least being used. 90% of people always select the default channel and that's not always the best channel. This is a nice unit, inexpensive, and works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Clay Welsh

customer_reviews.title: Bought 2 Netgear Routers Second One Died After 6 Months
customer_reviews.text: I ordered one of these in August for my daughter to take to college after earlier buying one at home and seeing how easy it was to set up. It's now 6 mos later and it has died. After a call to Netgear they want $140 for some kind of warranty plan to fix the router. Obviously a new one will be cheaper. So after experiencing a 50% failure rate in my small sample of 2 Netgear routers we opted to order the venerable workhorse a Linksys WRT54GL.
customer_reviews.author: Frequent Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Good Range and Bandwith for the Cost
customer_reviews.text: Using this router as a traveling IP cam solution for an investigation team and even with multiple cameras trying to bog this sucker down it will run and live stream the video and audio like I need it too. Happy I didn't buy the more expensive model for once. Side by side at home with my "better" Netgear that has dual signals this N300 serves a larger wifi net than the other. It is significantly slower but for less than 30 bucks compared to $120 for the other, this does the trick for now!
customer_reviews.author: sayheyjayray

customer_reviews.title: was very easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: it arrived as scheduled. was very easy to set up, way easier than Linksys router. But it only bumped my WiFi by 10mgb instead of getting the full 56-60 mgb. On linksys I was getting 19mgb/sec now it's about 29mgb, but connected to the modem wired directly I get 60 mgb/sec. The band-width should not be an issue because I am getting 60mgb when connect though the wire. So I am disappointed that this router did not bump it up higher as it is suppose to go up to 300mgb/sec.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: ... macbook pro without ethernet port) and it has worked fine for one month now
customer_reviews.text: I had no trouble setting it up (with a macbook pro without ethernet port) and it has worked fine for one month now. It seems some reviewers may have received defective routers, but I received one that works well so far and easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: melinda wilcox

customer_reviews.title: Great Home Router
customer_reviews.text: Still my favorite brand, even with the issues I chase.. I used to have a Belkin, but I finally switched it out.. to my amazement, half of my VPN connections worked, and half didn't.. oddly enough, when I switched from Belkin to NetGear, the ones that worked and didn't flipped.. quite odd.. Very fast response, wireless has great range for the power. mounts might have been nice, but low power requirements are nice. Unable to upgrade internally unless internet is plugged into the WAN. you have to download them and use the form to upload them.
customer_reviews.author: aj4mq

customer_reviews.title: Pain to set up with Charter but works great
customer_reviews.text: Charter told us this worked out of the box with their modem, but it 100% did not. We had to contact Charter and then netgear to get it set up and they did something on their end--there was no way we could have done it on our own. Works great and haven't had any problems, but expect to take 15-20 minutes on the phone to get it set up. Or maybe you'll have better luck than we did.
customer_reviews.author: Pinky

customer_reviews.title: Good Router
customer_reviews.text: I'm in IT and have been using many different brands of routers. I always like Netgear because they are usually easy to set up and reliable. This Netgear is a cheap and good device for home. Most of cable modem or FIOS speed is 50MB or less for the standard plan. You usually cannot get this speed because your home network technology is based on shared bandwidth. It means that the more people get onto the network, the slower it becomes. Therefore higher speed router would not get you anywhere faster than this router unless you plan to do lots of data transferring between your home computers. For me, this is a great router for my home.
customer_reviews.author: B. Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 1 week
customer_reviews.text: After attempting to hook up the Neatgear to my cable router, the Netgear continuously would drop the internet signal. Horrible as it worked for about a week, then started acting up and since it's past 30 days, I have no way to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Bob W

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered over 200 of these in the past 10 years as I have them setup in an apartment complex of 72 units, each unit has their own. They are easy to configure, quite reliable, and a great price. Good coverage for the wireless, lots of expert settings available if you choose otherwise plug and play with a pre defined wireless password conveniently stickered to the side or back of the router for simple technophobe deployment.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I needed a wireless router when I bought a smartphone that comes with 200 minutes talk, 500 texts, and 500 GB (yes, that's correct, GBs), monthly, free. But the phone works on Wi-Fi, otherwise it uses data as well as minutes. I use my cell phone very little. This router has a very good reputation; my son recommended it; and it works very well for my needs. No need to rent a wireless router from my service provider.
customer_reviews.author: hmmmingbird

customer_reviews.title: the modem is fine for those speeds
customer_reviews.text: Says it can deliver speeds up to 300mbps. The highest I've speeds I've had from the device was 90mbps. Normally i wouldn't complain but the bundle you can purchase it with, the modem is fine for those speeds. The second one I received thinking it could be defective could get speeds above 20mbps. Overall its a good product but not good for what I'm using (all these were done hardwired not wifi)
customer_reviews.author: Austin C.

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed. Had an old Netgear router of the same ...
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. Had an old Netgear router of the same model that lasted five years. Bought this as a replacement. Out of the box got constant disconnects when devices connected and other random times. Worked with tech support and they had me downgrade the Firmware. That completely destroyed the signal strength. I could only connect if I was right on top of the Router. Re upgrading back to the most recent firmware fixed that but the disconnections still happened. only recourse was an RMA. So I purchased a brand new Router a few weeks ago but will end up with a refurbished one, assuming the RMA even works.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good working router with some few flaws
customer_reviews.text: It works as its suppose to. I would have given this item five stars but I didn't due to a couple of things: 1) You cannot change the username to log into the settings from "account" to anything else. All that can be changed is the password. Even with my former, ancient wireless router, I still had the option to change the account name to something unique and boost safety, 2) The outer plastic material of this router feels really flimsy and cheap. It feels like it can easily crack (it also easily scratches on the outside).
customer_reviews.author: Barb B.

customer_reviews.title: Never again!
customer_reviews.text: Very bad luck with this router. WiFi signal problems since day 1. Getting ahold of netgear would take hours only to not have the issue fixed! We gave up and ended leasing a router from spectrum. Problem solved! I guess we won’t be getting our refund. Trash it goes! $30 down the drain!
customer_reviews.author: Gabriela Gerber

customer_reviews.title: Don’t bother... Dial up is faster
customer_reviews.text: Terrible WiFi router! I have had it for 1 week and not once has it given me a good WiFi signal all day without dropping connection. This router gave me a whopping 8 mbps (consistently) when I did the speed tests! I called Netgear’s tech support (twice) and they could not offer me any advice other than to return this product. Don’t waste your money...
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Miller

customer_reviews.title: Neat!
customer_reviews.text: We waited patiently for this product to arrive hoping to reduce some of the access problems we were having with a much older (and different manufacturer) router. All were solved with the successful installation. I must have been tired when I did it because I had a difficult time finding the on/off switch, but a second pair of eyes discovered it under a connection already made and the installation proceeded without any further difficulty. We are getting very efficient service now, much better than the one we had been using.
customer_reviews.author: F. B. F.

customer_reviews.title: Works for what I need it for, namely 3DS and mobile phone
customer_reviews.text: I bought this entirely to play 3DS games on and use with mobile internet. I guarantee this IS compatible with the 3DS. It works really well with both that and my Samsung Galaxy. I didn't need a long range in my small apt, so I cannot be sure how long of a range this has. Setup was a little tricky, they don't tell you to log into it with the wifi PW on the computer before you attempt to run the setup on the browser which is what I had to do before it successfully worked. I truly hope that it does not fail like my Belkin did, but it didn't fail yet. Knock on wood.
customer_reviews.author: kokopuffs

customer_reviews.title: Ever since we purchased this our internet quits working (only ...
customer_reviews.text: Ever since we purchased this our internet quits working (only momentarily) all the time. We noticed immediately that our laptop has a very difficult time connecting to the internet as well.
customer_reviews.author: melbell

customer_reviews.title: Tech support rip off! (Could never set the router up)
customer_reviews.text: Well I can't really comment on how the router actually works because I could never get it to work. One step in the instructions is to go to a .net page. After multiple attempts, this page never loaded. So I did the next logical thing and called tech support, who informed me it would cost 89 dollars to help me resolve this problem. That is almost twice what I paid for the router to just to set the thing up straight from the box! What a rip off!! Needless to say I am returning the product.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Zetllin

customer_reviews.title: Great home router!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router because the last one we had broke. It was easy to set up and has not had any problems since I purchased it. I have no complaints and would recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Koschnick

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: 7/2017 Bought this 4/2010 & used it for 5 years. Sold it for $40 in perfect working condition.
customer_reviews.author: bluezman714

customer_reviews.title: N isn't dead yet, a great backup router
customer_reviews.text: N might not be the latest or greatest standard, but these make for great low-cost backup devices. The user interface is clean and simple, and the device actually shipped with up to date firmware. Just be sure to change your default password.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Medic NJ

customer_reviews.title: I recently got gigabit internet and needed to buy a ...
customer_reviews.text: I recently got gigabit internet and needed to buy a new router. Bought one (non-netgear) without checking ethernet port speed and stupidly ended up with slow 10/100mbps ethernet ports. Shame on me for not checking. While looking for a replacement, found the Netgear product comparison chart in attached screenshot, and went with the lowest-end unit supporting gigabit internet (since the wireless connection speed/other bells and whistles are irrelevant to me). The "N300" link led to this product page. On arrival, discovered the router did NOT in fact support gigabit internet (see picture of specifications on box) - negating the entire reason I purchased it. One star because product does not perform as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: problem while connecting to windows 7 laptops
customer_reviews.text: this is a good product.. but there are a few problems.. when you connect windows 7 laptops to this router, they get disconnected very often.. and the net speed is also slow sometimes.. but dont worry, it happens like 2-3 times a day.. and we had some problems while playing games.. it restarts itself sometimes.. we had a problem once and returned this for a new one in exchange.. the customer service is great.. the problems occur not too often, but they do occur..
customer_reviews.author: SaiBorg007

customer_reviews.title: Takes awhile to get hooked up
customer_reviews.text: Hard to get netgear to respond Works great onc ed it is in
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Avant

customer_reviews.title: Great device
customer_reviews.text: This is a great value in a small package. I am not the most knowledgeable individual with computer however, I had this device installed in 10 minutes including the product registration.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty

customer_reviews.title: Caveat Emptor
customer_reviews.text: As expected, you get what you pay for. I'm still trying to find the magic words required to change the channel so that whenever my phone is picked up, all internet connections to my display and computers stay connected. Wireless is as wireless can do... I may need to replace my phone system as others have reported. Going back to 900mhz due to interference 'tween the router and phone system... seems it would be a forgone conclusion that new routers would be able to co-exist with older phone systems... not yet anyhow.
customer_reviews.author: Doug K.

customer_reviews.title: Awful awful awful.  I'll never by Netgear again.
customer_reviews.text: I set it up and got it running quickly, but the next morning my laptop could no longer connect. I called tech support, which was in India and infuriating, requesting a lot of information and plugging other products before they would consider my question. Now my laptop connects without issue, but my droid smartphone does not have internet access through the network, despite having an "excellent" strength connection. I'm going to try to return this ASAP.
customer_reviews.author: charlotte eloise

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not reliable...
customer_reviews.text: At first glance, it was good. Super fast, strong signal, good reach, simple setup. But beware...this router is not reliable. Even if you're sitting right next to it, you can lose signal and often times, the router will just reset or refresh itself kicking off any connected devices.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Router
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this router so far I purchased this for our 2 floor cottage. Has not dropped a connection once. I wish I had this router for my home, because our linksys drops the signal too frequently for my liking. I can't speak to the set up, but assume it was easy. The cable company and my husband set it up.
customer_reviews.author: Hmoss22

customer_reviews.title: speeds were good, range was pretty good for a unit with ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my parents' house, and the wifi antenna already crapped itself after about a year, which is on par with the cheaper end products. Just replaced it with an N750. Hopefully that lasts more than a year or so since it costs 2x as much. While it worked, speeds were good, range was pretty good for a unit with no antennas, just don't expect long life.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Alderson

customer_reviews.title: Don't do it!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible. Horrible customer service. Unable to set up. You follow the instructions to a T - yet their set up website cannot find their router. For months. I give up. Crap in a box. Go with anything else but Netgear. #ripoff
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Connected to my N600 for internet in my basement.  Worked great.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to relay into my basement off of my existing netgear N600 router. Connected them with an Ethernet cord and voila I have had fantastic high speed internet in my basement. Very pleased with the result.
customer_reviews.author: jacquelyn hurley

customer_reviews.title: It worked Great for about a year and then the wireless died
customer_reviews.text: It worked Great for about a year and then the wireless died. I called Netgear support. They checked the wired portion which was still working but told me the wireless isn't working due to high congestion. I tried to explain but the tech said it's not a hardware problem so he would not replace it.
customer_reviews.author: TV Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: More range please.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace a Lynksis brand router that was a few years older. Although it is one hundred times easier to use, its range is no better, even though according to specs it should be twice as powerful. I'm in a 1400 sqft home with the unit in the middle of house and I still get lackluster signal strength at one end or the other of home. Only slight impimprovement over previous router.
customer_reviews.author: sickcured

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Good product, too many ways to use it, AP, Repeating, etc
customer_reviews.author: Oscar Ml

customer_reviews.title: ONLY HAD THIS ROUTER 5 MONTHS, AND NOTHING BUT PROBLEMS!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router September 26, 2016. Have had nothing but problems with it. Finally it was determined by my Internet provider that it was the Netgear router that was causing all my problems. I am out of my window to return. to Amazon. The question I have is, can I get a refund from NetGear?
customer_reviews.author: Becki Stallings

customer_reviews.title: Bad Customer Support from Netgear!
customer_reviews.text: Beware of Netgear support, they are terrible to work with. They want to charge you $30 to replace any defective unit in a timely manner, other then that they just kind of jerk you along. Product is fine if it works, if not throw it away because they are not going to help. Beware!
customer_reviews.author: Dave Moses

customer_reviews.title: Does not reach 300 MBPS as advertised
customer_reviews.text: My internet provider plan provides for 200 MBPS download. I have a Ubee modem, with this router plugged in, and I only got 20MBS average download. Unplugged this router, and Ubee modem alone is now giving me 100 MBPS over wifi. Dont waste your money on this.
customer_reviews.author: aelachkar

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Set Up
customer_reviews.text: I am fairly comfortable with electronics and this router was really easy to set up. I would say that even with minimal experience with routers and computers, the instructions and setup program provided with the router will make set up a breeze for most people. The range is pretty good; I can get a signal from the router, which is set up in the basement, up on the second floor without any range extenders. Relatives and friends who visit have had no trouble accessing the network as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie Oh

customer_reviews.title: Only had for a few days
customer_reviews.text: I've only had it for a few days, but so far it's working great. I have TWC and the modem they provided constantly had interruptions. I was constantly resetting it and having issues daily. So far, I haven't had any. It's smooth and no buffering when I'm watching movies, and my son games with no lagging or interruptions.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Castaldo

customer_reviews.title: so far this item will not work and NETGEAR is ...
customer_reviews.text: so far this item will not work and NETGEAR is not willing to support the product they will not honor there warranty, registration, or provide support. the receipt upload on there web site is a scam because they can not access the information. This use to be a high quality go to company. No more they are obnoxious and do not have the ability or willingness to support there products.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Delivered defective
customer_reviews.text: Rate the item delivered, it was defective and would not connect to the web. I worked with the cox support and he had the same router. We both went through all possible configurations and the router would not connect. I went to Target and got a Cisco (Linksys) router and was up in running in ten minutes. I would not recommend buying online for this product if you need it to work. The return process worked well just a little disappointed they would ship a defective product.
customer_reviews.author: Eaglethorpe

customer_reviews.title: Did not work at all.
customer_reviews.text: Did not work at all. Cable installer tried repeatedly and so did I. It was a dud!
customer_reviews.author: K. A. Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Wrong Item Listed
customer_reviews.text: Units work fine but are an older version that was is listed. Ordered WNR2000v5 (as advertised) received WNR2000v4. Only visible difference is v4 is physically 30% lager than v5.
customer_reviews.author: B. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Warranty is really only 90 days as once free support expires the cost of Netgear Support for Netgear to be satisfied the unit is
customer_reviews.text: Lesson learned. Warranty is really only 90 days as once free support expires the cost of Netgear Support for Netgear to be satisfied the unit is defective is more than twice the price of a new router. Have 3 others of this model. Good router, reasonably priced and so far they remain working.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R Chase

customer_reviews.title: It's very easy to set up and has four slots for various ...
customer_reviews.text: This router is exactly what it's described on the website. It's very easy to set up and has four slots for various components. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Ching Hsiao

customer_reviews.title: it was good for a while!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this router for over a year now and is now when the problems started. Set up was simple, connection was working ok, speed was at 300 but then it started dropping the connection, router had to be reset sometimes to get connection again. I downloaded an update available for this router, hoping that this could solve the problem, it did it in certain way but it lost speed now, from 300 dropped to 130 and I can see the difference in speed now, it's getting really slower. Be careful when trying to update this router.
customer_reviews.author: M.W

customer_reviews.title: Light Compact Faster
customer_reviews.text: Easy Does it my old one was "killed" I guess by the same company that made it so I just move to ANOTHER BRAND and this one is good , decent price and easy to set up it does it by itself only it took few minutes to be running and FASTER easy to change the name and p.word it is a good router so far so good
customer_reviews.author: edgar cardona

customer_reviews.title: Usually NetGear is an excellent router, but for some reason
customer_reviews.text: Usually NetGear is an excellent router, but for some reason, this product doesn't connect to my laptop when visiting. It may be the operator, or the fact that I am trying to connect to another laptop. I own a NETGEAR N300 for my home, and bought another for my son's house when I visit. I have no problem with the one at home, so I may be experiencing a technical issue--otherwise, I would rate this product highly.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Davis

customer_reviews.title: Netgear WNR2000 Wireless Router
customer_reviews.text: We finally upgraded our 6 year old Belkin wireless router w/the Netgear WNR2000 & what a difference it makes. We have 3 different computers on our network & the wireless router connects to the internet almost instantly, no more waiting around for the old router to connect. It was simple to install & I really like the upright position. After my initial positive review, this router has proved to be a disappointment, it always has connectivity issues, requiring reboots & changing the wireless channels frequently, neither of which is very effective...i would not recommend this product...
customer_reviews.author: Nasser A. Nagi

customer_reviews.title: Netgear wireless router N300
customer_reviews.text: it works well but I am not sure if the connection problem is with this or my satellite service. I have to reset this quite a bit and it always says massive demand no matter what time of day. Never had one before so can't really compare to others, just can say what it does for me. Sorry guys, wish I could help more.
customer_reviews.author: dog lover

customer_reviews.title: could not get it to work
customer_reviews.text: I was never able to get this to work. The instructions were reasonably clear and suffered only from the problem that they were useless. The on-screen menus were not at all what that documentation said they would be and the options they said to select were not even available. I sent it back for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Hinds

customer_reviews.title: Much better than Linksys
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a replacement for Linksys routers(we have had both wired and wireless) that cost about the same if not more, but they make a TERRIBLE product. It would CONSTANTLY lose connection if you had two computers hooked up to it. Even with one computer connected to it, there would be connection problems!!! This Netgear router has never had this issue, or any other issues that I can think of that weren't easily fixed by a quick reset. It works, and that's more than I can say for Linksys.
customer_reviews.author: Vick N

customer_reviews.title: Ehh
customer_reviews.text: It was all good till about a week ago. And its past the complimentary support period so netgear will charge you for customer support so after 90 days if anything happens and its not easily solvable youre pretty much screwed into waiting to pay to solve something you already paid for. If you are ok with this, go ahead and purchase it worked well 80 percent of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Moyin Yusuf

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Great purchase experience and easy to install. In fact bought two and one connects to other and still was easy to install. Previously with an older model I had to use instructions from the web to connect them, but these realized one was going to be used only as an access point.
customer_reviews.author: Packer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for fixing my internet issue
customer_reviews.text: I got this product after having many connection issues with my ASUS router....which was sitting right next to my computer! I needed to find a router that was affordable, yet powerful to take on the traffic we have with wireless in my dorm room. The setup was incredibly easy to do and the sleek look was very appealing. I seem to still have a few issues with receiving full connections on certain days, but I'll take that over no connection any day! The internet seems to be working much faster, and its a lot smaller to fit properly where it needs to go. I would definitely recommend this product to someone.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: does the job
customer_reviews.text: This is the third netgear router I have used since first getting internet in 2008. They do a great job but don't seem to last very long. Instalation was extremely simple. I hooked up the router, turned on the computer, and clicked yes twice. If this router had a longer life I would gladly give it all 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: terry wilhite

customer_reviews.title: 100% garbage, died 2 weeks after the return window closed
customer_reviews.text: I gambled on a router this cheap and lost. It has simply stopped working, Jan. 31 was the last day I could have started a return. The power light glows yellow, that's it, that's all that happens now when you turn it on. I've already bought a new router (non-Netgear), this will be used for target practice I guess. I've tended to prefer Netgear equipment over the years but this one will really make me think twice.
customer_reviews.author: K. Gregory

customer_reviews.title: this will be my 3rd one,,,,,,
customer_reviews.text: I bought one for myself and now for each of my kids. Simple to use and has good range, no dead spots in my house like some wireless routers I had. I just cant believe people who do not change the password from the default! Works well for streaming videos ( I have a Roko and it set up with no issues.) No problems so far
customer_reviews.author: CG

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Was not able to connect and when I reached tech support they were hard to understand.
customer_reviews.author: myislandangel

customer_reviews.title: defective product
customer_reviews.text: The product has loose connector (yellow one) on the back of the router. I did not notice it within 7 days (return period). I have experienced three times offline since I bought it (13 days). I contacted the seller for an exchange. He says after 7 days everything is final. I will keep the product and try to live with it. But I am changing my review from 5 star to 2 star so others could be warned.
customer_reviews.author: fcai

customer_reviews.title: LOUSY Tech support,  lousy bridging or repeating..
customer_reviews.text: Crappy. Can't bridge, it can repeat they say but only at 54mb and only with WEP. That really sucks. But the absolute worst is their support. Hung up on me twice when they could not figure it out, waited for an hour for 2nd level support on 3rd try but gave up waiting. 54mb repeating is the best it can do, REALLY??? I like my Netgear 3700 just fine, but don't try to bridge or repeat with this brand..
customer_reviews.author: K. Mejias

customer_reviews.title: Netgear is a scam
customer_reviews.text: Pure misery. Stopped working after a period of time and it turns out the “lifetime warranty” advertised on the box is a lie. Conveniently, the website now says telephone support for my router costs $80, which was the price of the router itself. Nope, beware of this company.
customer_reviews.author: average consumer

customer_reviews.title: Great Performance
customer_reviews.text: This is my third. It replaced one that was about six years old and joined another that is about four years old. I have two wireless broadband connections supplying internet for my home business, our homeschool and just general family use. These routers work very well and have performed admirably.
customer_reviews.author: Dane Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Works well for an Apartment Setting
customer_reviews.text: The easy link button does exactly what it should, link to your computer when you need to connect with no need for a long password. It's small, lightweight, and has a nice on/off button for easy reseting. However the range is a little limited for devices other than computers. I know this is a result of the devices' range but also reflects the power of the router. Otherwise it works well and is great to have.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: This Tiny Router Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Had to reboot it a couple of times but communications electronics can be finicky -- even the expensive ones. For the price, this works fabulously and is a no-brainer to set up..
customer_reviews.author: Hank I.

customer_reviews.title: 14 for an IT technician to come to my house to tell me it was no good.
customer_reviews.text: I'd give it a ZERO if iIcould. This router failed right out of the box. I spent a frustrating week trying to set everything up. Then I spent $179.14 for an IT technician to come to my house to tell me it was no good.
customer_reviews.author: Navy Chuck

customer_reviews.title: For better programing!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This item was a gift to my daughter and what she said about her gift??? Just in One(1) word! AWESOME!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy as Pie
customer_reviews.text: The box arrived and we had wifi within 10 minutes. Works everywhere in the house (3000 sqft) located in the office on the main level and covers the interior as well as a fair perimeter around the house. I never setup any security on it, no point, closest neighbor is a half mile away and public access road is just as far. Unless the bears and moose start stealing wifi.... So overall I gave it 5 stars across the board for ease of setup, price, shipping, etc...
customer_reviews.author: sinker

customer_reviews.title: great customizing options
customer_reviews.text: Quick speeds, great customizing options, and I've had 0 issues with this router since I purchased it back in 2012. It's held up to standards today without any issues, and this is a WAY better option than renting equipment from the cable company at a cost.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Works without problems
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to install but, i do have experience doing this. I have had it for sometime and i have not had problems. I live in an apartment and have a hot tub and pool a couple hundred feet away. I take my ipad to the pool and connect. I can use my ipad and bluetooth headset to listen to Pandora. If it had a connection for an external antenna i would have gone to five stars. I would like to give it greater reach.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: No question this is easy to set up and use. i purchased one for my sister and it's worked out perfectly for her. I also have one and the only negative is the tendency of it to just stop working, resulting in my having to power it down, then back up. This is a weekly occurrence. Annoying, but I deal with it.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Working just fine!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this router as a refurbished model. My wife purchased a new iPod Touch and she wanted the WiFi in the house. I was a bit concerned how far the signal would reach (through walls, down the hall, etc...) but so far it's working just fine! Easy to install. I did have a little trouble setting it up but I'm not the IT man of the year. It took me about an hour (going online to get instructions and help) - that's not too bad. For the money this one is serving us well.
customer_reviews.author: Jim D. Brown

customer_reviews.title: I find that Netgear is pretty reliable with little to no issues
customer_reviews.text: This router replaced another Netgear router I had for over 8 years. I find that Netgear is pretty reliable with little to no issues. Installation was fairly simple and creating an ID and password is easy as well when using the Netgear genie. Would recommend this product for anyone looking for a fairly basic router.
customer_reviews.author: ek

customer_reviews.title: NETGEAR N300 Router
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to replace an existing NETGEAR G router that had given years of service but was slowing under the strain of multiple networked computers streaming videos etc. Setup was easy except for a wireless printer that would not accept the network passwork. However, it was connected successfully using the push to connect feature. So far has been running for two weeks without problems or resets. Noticeably faster than the old network. A great upgrade for a modest outlay.
customer_reviews.author: ihrich

customer_reviews.title: NOT NEW
customer_reviews.text: Product works perfectly, Description said NEW but came without original packaging and had scratches on unit. New should be never pulled out of the box except to verify continence and then put back in.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Rudolph

customer_reviews.title: Great router, easy set up
customer_reviews.text: Set up was incredibly easy. Instructions were very straightforward. We were up and running within four minutes after I opened the box. The signal is excellent and reaches everywhere on my property (I have a 3 bedroom house and we have a plot of land that is about .15 acres). Overall, excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Jason C

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I have not had any connection issues or problems so far
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: It keeps dropping devices especially my wife's iPhone 6+ and one of our smart TVs. I am constantly rebooting it to get ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this router for a few months. It has become a constant headache. It keeps dropping devices especially my wife's iPhone 6+ and one of our smart TVs. I am constantly rebooting it to get it to work temporarily. I wouldn't recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: david graham

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This router is great. I've been using mine now for a couple of months and it works seamlessly on my wireless network. If a visitor with a laptop wants access he can do so with a password I provide. The router converts the password to a WEP code that is encrypted making the network very secure. The range increased dramatically over my former "G" network. I can sit in the car on the street and still have access. Overall a 5 Star rating from me.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN OGARA

customer_reviews.title: No WI FI on/off switch!
customer_reviews.text: Item shipped wthout WI FI on off switch. The description on amazon shows specifically that it has WI FI on off switch which is one of the main reasons for purchasing. Netgear was a hassle to contact and happy to waste my time indefinately on this issue. Amazon was awesome and very helpful on the return. Boo on Netgear!
customer_reviews.author: gregg hammond

customer_reviews.title: Great Range not for VOIP or LG bluray player
customer_reviews.text: Very flaky when used in a city environment (with lots of other Wifi) had to reset it at least once a week. Did not work with PAPT2 VOIP had to install a hacked firmware to get it to work. My LG bluray player often will not connect to it even though its about 10-15 ft away (did not have this problem with old router). When it works it works OK great range and speed just a constant headache to keep it working and the get it working with all my equipment.
customer_reviews.author: D Fish

customer_reviews.title: A fast & easy network
customer_reviews.text: Customer wanted fast & easy network... got her this... she took it home and did it herself! Told her she could but she didn't believe me; told her to READ and FOLLOW the cd installation and she would be fine. She did and was. She loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Don Stozicki

customer_reviews.title: Not Compatible with DD-WRT
customer_reviews.text: Giving 5 stars as I did not use this router for very long. I bought this router blindly assuming it would be compatible with DD-WRT when, in fact, it is not. For when I did use it, it worked as intended without any hiccups.
customer_reviews.author: Rider Adkins

customer_reviews.title: One of the better cheap routers out there....
customer_reviews.text: What can i say, one of the better cheap N routers out there. Setup is not for the "novice" (i didn't think the auto setup was great), but if you have set up a router before you will not have a problem using the advanced setup mode. I have not had 1 problem with this router since setting it up. It's fast and im on G speeds still. Take a chance on it, Netgear has a great reputation in the industry, i think you'll like it!
customer_reviews.author: BlackSwan

customer_reviews.title: it was an pain becase the net geni app did not work with my computer it actually made the problr=em of setting up worse. i see a
customer_reviews.text: it took almost one week to set this router up. it was an pain becase the net geni app did not work with my computer it actually made the problr=em of setting up worse. i see a slight improvment in the wifi going to try and make my old router a extender.
customer_reviews.author: frank b

customer_reviews.title: It beats what I had
customer_reviews.text: It installed easily and worked out of the box. The only problem s that it is top heavy and wants to fall over with little provocation. My only issue is that my Netgear range extender doesn't want to work properly with the router. It keeps losing track of the connection. Other than those few issues this is a great product and a very good price. I would buy it again. I'm a nit picker.
customer_reviews.author: FarmAnimal

product_meta.title: NETGEAR Wireless Router - N300 (WNR2000)
product_meta.description:
Color:BlackWireless-router

AMAZON.COM




FROM THE MANUFACTURER


SIMPLE SHARING
The NETGEAR N300 Wireless Router is a simple and secure way to share your high-speed Internet connection at Wireless-N speeds for surfing the Internet, email, online chat and Facebook. Easy CD-less installation for iPad, tablets, smart-phones, and computers, while Wi-Fi Protected Setup gives you a secured connection at the push of a button. Compatibility with Wireless—G networks allows hassle-free connection flexibility.

The NETGEAR Difference – WNR2000 *  Lifetime Warranty
 * Guest network access
 * Wi-Fi on/off button
 * Power on/off button
 * Wireless repeater mode

ApplicationsLive Parental Controls – Keep your internetexperience safe—blockinappropriate web sites FREE!NETGEAR Genie – CD-less installation 
PERFORMANCE
 * Wireless-N – Basic Wireless (2.4GHz) connection for applications like surfing the Web, email and Facebook 
 * 
 * Fast Ethernet – Fast Ethernet 4-Port switch to connect up to 4 devices 
 * 
 * Wireless repeater mode – Configurable as a wireless repeater for extending range 
 * 

EASE OF USE
 * NETGEAR Genie – Easy-to-use dashboard to monitor, control and repair home networks
 * 
 * Easy Setup – Easy CD-less installation for iPad, tablets, smart-phones, and computer
 * 
 * Share Internet Connection – The freedom of wireless
 * 
 * Configurable LED – Provides visual indication of guest network, broadband usage meter, Live Parental Controls, and data traffic status
 * 

SECURITY
 * Push'N'Connect – Offers a secured wireless Internet connection at the push of a buttonn
 * 

FEATURES
 * Guest Network Access – Separate and secure access for guests using the WiFi network 
 * 
 * Broadband Usage Meter – Monitors Internet traffic and sends customized reports to help keep costs under control 
 * 
 * Live Parental Controls – Keeps your Internet experience safe and protects all connected devices on your network such as PC's, gaming consoles, and tablets 
 * 

CHOOSE THE WIRELESS ROUTER THAT FITS YOUR NEEDS

WARRANTY

SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS

 * Microsoft Internet Explorer 5.0, Firefox 2.0 orSafari 1.4 or higher

STANDARDS

PERFORMANCE

 * Supports Wireless Multimedia (WMM) based QoSSecurity

 * Double firewall protection (SPI and NAT firewall)

 * Exposed Host (DMZ) for secure gaming

EASE OF USE

PHYSICAL SPECIFICATIONS

NETGEAR GREEN FEATURES
